H0.text: What author penned a satirical essay in 1729, entitled A Modest Proposal, modestly proposing that the poor should eat their babies. Jonathan Swift

H1.text: What author penned a satirical essay in 1729, entitled A Modest Proposal, modestly proposing that the poor should eat their babies. Alexander Pope

H2.text: What author penned a satirical essay in 1729, entitled A Modest Proposal, modestly proposing that the poor should eat their babies. Voltaire

H3.text: What author penned a satirical essay in 1729, entitled A Modest Proposal, modestly proposing that the poor should eat their babies. Cadenus

A4.text: A Modest Proposal is a 1729 Juvenalian satirical essay by Anglo-Irish writer and clergyman Jonathan Swift

A5.text: The essay's satirical nature and historical context are explicitly tied to Jonathan Swift, not Alexander Pope, Voltaire, or Cadenus
